snippet: A move would allow health campaigners and journalists from many poor countries to at least watch the annual meeting, which considers questions of life and death.
abstract: World Health Organization, responding to angry letter published in a British medical journal, says it may soon start streaming its annual meeting of world’s health ministers on the web, where it can be viewed by health campaigners and journalists from poor countries who cannot afford to attend.
lead_paragraph: A move would allow health campaigners and journalists from many poor countries to at least watch the annual meeting, which considers questions of life and death.

headline.main: W.H.O. May Begin Webcast of Health Ministers’ Meeting
